body:
I don't think this properly detects on Linux. `__BYTE_ORDER == __BIG_ENDIAN` evaluates to true on my little endian machine. At least on gcc you can get defined macros as `gcc -E -dM - < /dev/null | grep ENDIAN` which suggests you want to use

`#if (__BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__)`

Also, maybe the whole thing can be just turned into
`constexpr bool kLittleEndian = __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_LITTLE_ENDIAN__;`
